text: Our Garden, our garden - not so much the garden, but the copse alongside it, wild, a secret way plunging down to the shore and then nothing but water between you and France.  The Devil's Chimney it was called -  The Devil's Chimney, I don't know why.  Darling.  My darling.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Every night I cut out my heart but in the morning it was full again.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Thank you.  Will you bury Geoffrey?  I know he's dead.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
And a good read.  Don't waste it.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I promise I'll come back.  I promise I'll never leave you.  And there's plenty of water and food. You can have a party.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Do you promise?  I wouldn't want to die here.  I wouldn't want to die in the desert. I've always had a rather elaborate funeral in mind, with particular hymns.  Very English.  And I know exactly where I want to be buried.  In our garden.  Where I grew up. With a view of the sea.  So promise me you'll come back for you.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Listen to me, Katharine.  You've broken your ankle and I'm going to have to try and bind it.  I think your wrist might be broken, too - and some ribs, which is why it's hurting you to breathe.  I'm going to have to walk to El Taj.  Given all the traffic in the desert these days I should bump into one army or another before I reach there - or Fenelon-Barnes and his camel.  And then I'll be back and we'll be fine, and I'll never leave you.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'm just going to find things for the fire.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I know.  I'm sorry.  I'll make a fire. I'll be back.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Of course.  You idiot.  I always wear it. I've always worn it.  I've always loved you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You're wearing the thimble.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You speak so many bloody languages and you never want to talk.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Don't you know you drove everybody mad?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
We've got to get you out of here.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Please don't move me.  It hurts too much.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Katharine!  Oh dear God, Katharine - what are you doing here?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Do you think you're the only one who feels anything?  Is that what you think?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Dance with me.  I want to touch you. I want the things which are mine. Which belong to me.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You know why? He tries to hold her. She resists,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I've watched you - on verandahs, at Garden Parties, at the Races - how can you stand there?  How can you ever smile?  As if your life hadn't capsized?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Is he next?  Do you drag him into your little room?  Where is it?  Is this it?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
What?  What?  That boy, that little boy, you were holding his collar, gripping his collar, what for?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Why did you hold his collar?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I just wanted you to know. I'm not missing you yet. She nods, can't find this funny.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I just know - any minute he'll find out, we'll barge into somebody we'll - and it will ill him.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'm not agreeing.  Don't think I'm agreeing, because I'm not.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'd better get back.  Say goodbye here.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Of course.  You didn't need to slap my face to make me feel as if you'd slapped my face.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
That day, had you followed me to the market?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I don't care to bargain.  It's full of saffron, just in case you think I'm giving it to you to encourage your sewing.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
This is a different world - is what I tell myself.  A different life. And here I am a different wife.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Madox knows, I think.  He's tried to warn me.  He keeps talking about Anna Karenina.  I think it's his idea of a man-to-man chat.  Its my idea of a man-to-man chat.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I thought we were against ownership?  I can stay tonight.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
This - what's it called? - this place, I love it - this is mine!  I'm asking the King permission to call it the Almasy Bosphorous.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You bastard, I was believing you!",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Ouch!  See - you're always beating me..!,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

It's a long song - Szerelem means love…and the story - there's a Hungarian Count, he's a wanderer, a fool.  For years he's on some kind of quest, who knows what? And then one day he falls under the spell of a mysterious English woman - a harpy - who beats him and hits him and he becomes her slave.  He sews her clothes, he worships the hem of -",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
It's beautiful.  What's it about?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
No, no, it's Hungarian.  My daijka sang it to me.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'm trying to write with your taste in my mouth.  Swoon.  I'll catch you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I can't work.  I can't sleep. Lady Hampton calls impatiently.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Say you're feeling faint - the sun.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Ownership.  Being owned.  When you leave, you should forget me.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Marmite - addicted!  Baths - not with other people!  Islands.  Your handwriting.  I could go on all day.  My husband. Almásy nods.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
What do I love?  I love rice pudding, and water, the fish in it, hedgehogs! The gardens at our house in Freshwater - all my secret paths.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Okay.  And what do you love? Say everything.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
That makes it harder still.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
A woman should never learn to sew, and if she can she should never admit to it.  Close your eyes.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I believe you still have my book.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Mrs. Clifton - Katharine turns, disgusted.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
No, the marriage isn't a fiction.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
And the marriage - is that a fiction? ,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Geoffrey's not in Cairo.  He's not actually a buffoon.  And the plane wasn't a wedding present. It belongs to the British Government.  They want aerial maps of the whole North Africa. So I think he's in Ethiopia.  In case you were counting on his sudden appearance.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Find that plant.  Cut out its heart.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Water?  Yes, we have water, we have a little in our can, we have water in the radiator which can be drunk. Not at all cowardly, extremely practical.  Come on, come on!  There's also a plant - I've never seen it but I'm told you can cut a piece the size of a heart from this plant and the next day it will be filled with a delicious liquid.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Of course.  Is it, am I a terrible coward to ask how much water we have?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Could I ask you, please, to paste you paintings into my book?  I should like to have them.  I should be honored.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Madox will have calculated how many miles, they'll soon turn around.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

All true.  Herodotus, your friend, tells of a wind - the Simoon - so evil that a nation declared war on it and marched out to fight it in full battle dress, their swords raised.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Fiction.  We had a house on that coast and it never rained blood. Go on.  More.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

- there is the Harmattan, a red wind. Which Mariners called the sea of darkness.  Red sand from this wind has flown as far as the south coast of England, producing showers so dense they were mistaken for blood. Almasy checks to see if Katharine is still awake.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Yes is a comfort.  Absolutely is not.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
In an hour there will be no stars. The air is filling with sand.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
They're so untidy.  I'm just trying to rearrange them.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
See what's happening to them - the stars.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You should come into the shelter.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
And that would be unconscionable, I suppose, to feel any obligation? Yes.  Of course it would.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
There's really no need.  This is just a scrapbook.  I should feel obliged.  Thank you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
We took several photographs, there's no need.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I thought you might paste them into your book.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Ask Al Auf. Almásy asks Al Auf in Arabic.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Be careful?  You mean you - or me? Who?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
What is he saying?  Come on, what did he say?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

The Ostrich is a detour.  A poor man hunts an ostrich, it's the method.  Nothing to do with Zerzura.  To catch an ostrich you must appear not to move.  The man finds a place where the ostrich feeds, a wadi, and stands where the ostrich can see him, on the horizon, and doesn't move, doesn't eat - otherwise the ostrich will run.  At nightfall, he moves, fifty, sixty yards.  When the ostrich comes the next day, the man is there, but he's nearer.  Haunting the ostrich.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Sounds perfectly clear.  Where does the Ostrich come in?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
A mountain curved like a woman's back, a plateau the shape of an ear.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

This is an incredible story - about a man hunting an Ostrich, he's been telling me about Zerzura, he thinks he's been there, but his map, the route he's describing, he couldn't survive the journey now, but he's a poet, so his map is poetry - and now we're onto an Ostrich.  I'm telling her your map is poetry. The Arab shrugs.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
So why follow me?  Escort me, by all means.  Following me is predatory, isn't it?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
As the wife of one of our party.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I was concerned.  As I said, women in that part of Cairo, a European women, I felt obliged to.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
After the market, you followed me to the hotel.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Why did you follow me yesterday?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

I should be very happy to obtain the correct price for this.  I apologize if I appear abrupt.  I am rusty at social graces.  How do you find Cairo?  Did you visit the Pyramids?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I don't believe that.  I think you are insulted by me, somehow. You're a foreigner too, aren't you, here, in this market?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
This is not worth eight pounds, Mrs. Clifton.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You've been cheated, don't worry, we'll take it back.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Seven pounds, eight, I suppose. Why?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
They don't see foreign women in this market.  How much did you pay?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Yes, thank you, Gyges, son of Daskylus - Candaules said to him I don't think you believe me when I tell you how beautiful my wife is. And although Gyges replied he did find the Queen magnificent the King insisted he would find some way to prove beyond dispute that she was fairest of all women.  Do you all know this story?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'm sorry - what have you noticed?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I can't sing.  but I can tell a story.  I might need a prompt.  Do you have your Herodotus?  I've noticed you carry it…,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Isn't Zerzura supposed to be protected by spirits who take on the shape of sandstorms?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
A thing is still a thing no matter what you place in front of it.  Big car, slow car, chauffeur-driven car, still a car.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I wanted to meet a man who could write such a long paper with so few adjectives.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

And the people here don't want us. Are you kidding?  The Egyptians are desperate to get rid of the Colonials…  - isn't that right? Their best people get down on hands and knees begging to be spared a knighthood.  Isn't that right?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Oops!  Mustn't say International. Dirty word.  Filthy word.  His Majesty! Die Führer!  Il Duce.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Why are you people so threatened by a woman?!,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

I've known Katharine since she was three, my aunt is her aunt, we were practically brother and sister before we were man and wife.  I think I'd know what is and what isn't too much for her.  I think she's know herself.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
All the same, I, were I you I would be concerned -",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Are you mad?  Katharine loves it here. She told me yesterday.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I think the desert is, it's - for a woman - it's very tough, I wonder if it's not too much for her.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Clifton - your wife - do you think it's appropriate to leave her?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Portraits.  The Brigadier, the Brigadier's wife, the Brigadier's dogs, the Brigadier at the Pyramids, the Brigadier breathing.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Uxoriousness - that's my favorite kind of love.  Excessive love of one's wife.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
No!  NO!  Don't radio anybody, just give me the fucking jeep!",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I understand you are agitated - perhaps you would like to sit down while I radio back to HQ -,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Look, listen to me.  A woman is dying - my wife! - is dying seventy miles from here.  I have been walking for three days!  I don't want to spell my name, I want you to give me this jeep!",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Almásy - would you mind just spelling that for me?  What nationality would that be?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Count Laszlo de Almásy. The Officer is writing this down.  A glance at his Corporal.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Right.  And what's your name, sir?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Am I not talking sense? -  forgive me, I'm, I've been walking, I've - there's a woman badly injured at Gilf Kebir, in the Cave of Swimmers.  I am a member of the Royal Geographical Society.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
If I could just see some identification.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

No, I'm not thinking clearly - I need a doctor too, to come with me, can I take this vehicle?  I'll pay, of course - and some morphine and…  Seventy miles - I can be back here by dusk.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I desperately need a jeep.  There's been an accident.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Yes, of course.  So, golly, where have you come from?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Could I trouble you for some water?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
There is no God.  But I hope someone looks after you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
May God make safety your companion.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Goodbye, my friend. They shake hands.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I have to teach myself not to read too much into everything.  Comes of too long having to read so much into hardly anything at all.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'll leave the plane in the hangar at Kufra Oasis.  So if you need it…hard to know how long one's talking about.  We might all be back in a month or two.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Tomorrow afternoon.  Don't worry. I'll be ready.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
When's Clifton picking you up?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Yes.  It was.  Thanks for the compass. I'll look after it for you.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
We didn't care about countries. Did we?  Brits, Arabs, Hungarians, Germans.  None of that mattered, did it?  It was something finer than that.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Bermann thinks he'll be interned, poor fellow.  I'm going to do what I can, but…  And D'Ag turns out to be a great admirer of Mussolini. So now you can say I told you so.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Had a letter from my wife.  The wisteria is still out, which I'm looking forward to.  She says Dorset is gripped with Invasion Fever.  Wrong coast I should have thought, still…",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Absolutely right, shut up. Lashings of apologies all round.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Look, either shut up, or go home.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Good, we're all here?  A toast, to the International Sand club - may it soon resurface.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
What do we find in the desert? Arrow heads, spears.  In a war, if you own the desert, you own North Africa.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Why do they care about our maps?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Don't be so bloody naïve.  You know there's a war breaking out.  This arrived this morning.  By order of the British Government - all International Expeditions to be aborted by May 1939.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Those maps belong to His Majesty's Government.  They're confidential. They shouldn't be left lying around for any Tom, Dick or Mary to have sight of.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
And where are the Expedition Maps?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Which we couldn't explore because of rocks, because of cross-winds, it's sloppy.  And here - and here - we could be staring at Zerzura.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Which we've overflown twice.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

No, because you can't see from the air! If you could explore from the air life would be very simple!  Look!  What is that?  Is that a wadi? That whole spur is a real possibility…",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
And I'm telling you there's nothing there to explore.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Try to get a second radiator, we'll bury it between here and the Pottery Hill. And a better jack. We planned badly.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'll be back as quick as I can. Thirty-six hours at the outside.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Cut the ropes.  I left a note, on his blanket.  At the next Geographical Society I shall await with great interest the announcement of the Fenelon-Barnes Slave Knot.  The Girl wouldn't leave, of course.  Her father had sold her for a camel. He turns over the propeller, the engine cranks up.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I was talking about the girl.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I looked at them.  They're shrubs, small trees.  Exquisite.  And fossilized, rock hard. He walks away to the nose of the plane.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Her hands and feet were tied.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You shouldn't go into another man's tent. It's inexcusable.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Looking for the fossils.  Why should we wait until we're in London?  This girl was probably twelve years old.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
What did you think you were doing in his tent?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
That's your name innit?  Count Fucking Arsehole Von Bismarck? What's that supposed to be then, Irish?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Fritz?  What are you talking about? Who's Fritz?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Listen, Fritz, if I have to listen to another word from you I'll give you a fucking good hiding.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Please - I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, please listen to me, this is a terrible mistake. Just stop, please, and listen to me.  My wife is dying.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Hey!  Hey!  Stop this jeep!  Let me out of here - there's a woman dying, there's a woman dying while I'm - Hey!",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Would it? She kisses him, very softly, on the lips.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Just kiss me.  It would mean such a lot to me.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
No, I'll get you some tea. Wait till you're in Naples.  You'll find a girl there.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You're the prettiest girl I ever saw.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Your leg will be fine.  A lot of shrapnel came out - I saved you the pieces.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Go!  Hey!  Go! Caravaggio is in terror.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Well, you must know.  You were brought up Libya, yes?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I slept with the girl.  I've got a wife in Tripoli.  A girl comes up and points at you, you only see trouble.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Why is there so much nose?  I can't hear myself think!  Look - give me something.  So we can all get out of this room.  A name.  A code.  It's too hot.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
A nurse?  Well, sure, a nurse is great. A nurse?  Great.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
We don't have a doctor, but we do have a nurse.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Yes, I've been asking for weeks, a month, I don't know, also my leg was -",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You are a Canadian spy working for the Allies.  Code-name Moose.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
It's impossible.  I was buying or selling something.  I've been to Cairo many times.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
It is you.  This was taken in Cairo at British Headquarters - July 41. And so was this - August 41.  And this -February 42.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I keep explaining.  You've got the wrong man.  My name is Bellini - Antonio Bellini.  Bellini, Caravaggio, both painters, I think that is confusing you.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Petty thief, six months imprisonment Kingston Penitentiary, 1937.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
She can take you as far as Florence.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
What's happened?  Kip!  What's happening? Don't shoot, please, don't shoot anybody.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
No-one should own music.  The real question is who wrote the song?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I think that's called looting.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Please don't creep around this house.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Ask him.  Ask your saint who he is. Ask him who he's killed.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I don't know what that means.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'm one of his ghosts and he wouldn't even know.  It's like he slammed a door in Cairo and it trapped my fucking hands in Tobruk.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
What if I told you he did this to me?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'm not in love with him.  I'm in love with ghosts.  And so is he. He's in love with ghosts.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

You have to protect yourself from sadness.  This is the thing I've learned.  You're in love with him, aren't you? Your patient.  Do you think he's a saint or something?  Because of the way he looks?  I don't think he is.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'll have some of your water.  It's hot.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Don't touch me if you're going to try and fuck me.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Some gave me a dress.  You know what's great?  What I'm learning? You win a war and you not only gain the miles you get the moral ground. Everywhere I go, we're in the right. I like that.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
What do you do?  What are you doing here?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You should be happy.  What were you going to do for him when it ran out? He pulls out more phials from his jacket.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
It's a week.  We didn't know where you were - or if you coming back, or -",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Can you cook the rabbit or will you try and bring that back to life?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I could help you.  I could get you off that.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Supper. Hana calls after him.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Because we're fine here.  I don't know what Mary told you about me, but I don't need company, I don't need to be looked at.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I'm okay.  Look, it's a big house. We needn't disturb each other.  I can shoot a pistol!  I'll sleep in the stables.  I don't care where I sleep.  I don't sleep.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
If you said yes I would have had a reason.  You should let me redress those bandages.  Before you go.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

I'd like to stay.  That's the long and short of it.  I mean, you know blah-blah if it's convenient, if there's room blah-blah-blah.  I have to do some work here -I speak the language. There are Partisans to be -  -we embrace them and see if we can relieve them of their weapons, you know - while we hug.  I was a thief, so they think I'd be good at that.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

They're fresh.  I haven't eaten an egg in…have you noticed there are chickens? You get chickens in Italy but no eggs. In Africa there were always eggs, but never chickens. Who separates them?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

I met your friend Mary.  She said I should stop and see if you were okay. Apparently we're neighbors - my house is two blocks from yours in Montreal. Cabot, north of Laurier.  Bonjour.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Buon' Giorno! Hana turns, startled and suspicious.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You can't kill me.  I died years ago.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

You get to the morning and the poison leaks away, doesn't it? Black nights, fucking black nights, when you want to howl like a dog. I thought I would kill you.  You killed my friends, you ruined my hands.  But the girl was always here, like some Guardian Angel.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Yes, I got back there finally to keep my promise.  To come back for her. And then of course I couldn't… I couldn't even do that properly.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
And did you never see Katharine? You never got back to the Cave?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Is that what you thought?  That I betrayed the British?  The British betrayed me.  The British betrayed me.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
But you were among the British, they were your friends - why betray them?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Thousands of people did die, just different people.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

There was a result to what you did. It wasn't just another expedition.  It did this.  If the British hadn't unearthed your nosey photographer in Cairo thousands of people could have died.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
The rest meant nothing to me.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
I had to get back to the desert. I made a promise.  The rest meant nothing to me.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
You were the only man who knew the desert well enough, the only man who would cross seventeen hundred miles of nothing.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
And you thought you'd come and settle the score?,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

I don't even know if it is my book. The Bedouin found it in the plane, in the wreckage.  It's mine now. I heard your breathing and thought it might be rain. I'm dying for rain - of course I'm dying anyway - but I long to feel rain on my face.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

I can taste it. I'm chewing the mint.  Is there sand in my eyes?  Are you cleaning sand from my ears?",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

I'll always go back to that church. Look at my painting.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

When I went to England I was amazed at what went on, the waste - I'd been taught to re-use everything, the dung from a cow to cool a radiator, a fork to fix a typewriter - India could live for a hundred years on what I saw thrown away.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

That gun at Lahor, Kipling's cannon - Zamzammah - remember?  That was made out of the metal of ordinary things. I want to make an ordinary thing out of guns. His bayonet is thrust into the forge.  It's red hot.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

I was thinking yesterday - yesterday! - the Patient, Hardy: they're everything that's good about England. I couldn't even say what that was. We didn't exchange two personal words, and we've been together through some terrible things, some -  he was engaged to a girl in the village! - I mean -  and us - he never once… He didn't ask me if I could spin the ball at cricket or the kamasutra or - I don't even know what I'm talking about.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
This is what I do.  I do this every day.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Don't go.  I'm frightened.  I can love a coward, I can't love another dead man.",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
